content.question: Which of the following rhythms is beamed correctly?

choices.label: Choice A shows a single measure. The time signature for is twelve eight time. The rhythm in option A is shown as: dotted eighth, sixteenth, and eighth all beamed together, quarter, two sixteenths beamed together, three eights beamed together, a lone eighth, and a quarter.

Choice B shows a single measure. The time signature for is twelve eight time. The rhythm of option B is: dotted eighth and sixteenth beamed together, two eighths beamed together with a tie on the second, an eighth with tie and two sixteenths all beamed together, two eighths beamed, two eighths beamed, and a quarter.

Choice C shows a single measure. The time signature for is twelve eight time. The rhythm for option C is: dotted eighth, sixteenth, and eighth all beamed together, quarter, then two sixteenths and four eighths all beamed together, and a quarter.

Choice D shows a single measure. The time signature for is twelve eight time. The rhythm of measure for option D is: dotted eighth, sixteenth, and eighth all beamed, quarter, two sixteenths and an eighth beamed together, three eighths beamed together, and a quarter.

content.answer: Choice A shows a single measure. The time signature for is twelve eight time. The rhythm in option A is shown as: dotted eighth, sixteenth, and eighth all beamed together, quarter, two sixteenths beamed together, three eights beamed together, a lone eighth, and a quarter.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Use symbols and terms to describe features of rhythm in notated music, including meter, note values, and rhythmic patterns and devices.
